data.title: Trains from Milan to Brig
data.meta_description: Take the train from Milan to Brig and get to your destination in just over 1 hour 30 minutes for as little as 25€. The distance is 120 Km so it's a great way to travel.
data.text:
Journey from Milan to Brig: Take a Train to Enjoy the Alpine Views

Take a train from Milan to Brig and enjoy the breathtaking views of the Swiss Alps along the way. The journey, which takes about 5 hours, covers a distance of around 270 miles (435 km). During the journey, you'll pass through the cities of Milan, Magadino, Domodossola, and Brig, as well as other towns in the region.

From Milan, you'll depart from Milan Central Station and arrive in Brig Central Station. Along the way, you'll have plenty of opportunities to admire the stunning views. The most iconic site may be the Simplon Pass, a mountain pass that links Brig, Switzerland, and Domodossola, Italy.

From Domodossola, the train will take you through the Val d’Ossola and Brig, before ending up in Brig Central Station. During the journey, you'll pass through some of Switzerland's most stunning scenery, from the picturesque mountain valleys of Val d’Ossola to the snow-covered Alps. You'll also be able to admire the architectural brilliance of Brig's 15th-century cobblestone streets.

At the end of your journey, take some time to explore the city of Brig. Some of the most popular attractions include the Stockalper Palace, the Church of St. Ursus, and the Historical Museum.

Whether you are looking for a relaxing break or an exciting adventure, a train journey from Milan to Brig is the perfect way to explore the diverse beauty of this region. So, book your tickets today and enjoy the stunning Swiss Alps views!

Welcome to Milan, the fashion capital of Italy! This vibrant city is full of historic sites, architectural marvels, and delicious cuisine. Whether you’re a history buff, architecture enthusiast, or hungry traveler, Milan has something to offer. Here’s a list of must-see places and other insider tips to make the most of your trip.

Duomo di Milano: This iconic, Gothic-style cathedral is the largest in Italy and a must-see in Milan. It was built in 1386 and features a stunning design inside and out, with 135 spires and thousands of statues. Visitors can climb the 463-step staircase for great views of the city from the terrace. Location: Piazza del Duomo, Hours: 7am to 7pm Mon-Sun, Entrance fee: €15.

Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II: This iconic 19th-century shopping center is located in the heart of Milan and is considered one of the world’s oldest. It is a great place to relax, shop, and try some delicious Italian food. Location: Piazza del Duomo, Hours: 10am to 8pm Mon-Sun, Entrance fee: Free.

Teatro alla Scala: Also known as La Scala, this opera house is a symbol of Milan’s cultural heritage and one of Italy’s most famous theaters. Visitors can purchase tickets to a show, or take a tour of the building and learn about its history and architecture. Location: Largo Ghiringhelli 1, Hours: 9am to 5pm Mon-Sun, Entrance fee: €8.

Castello Sforzesco: This 15th-century castle was once the home of the rich and powerful Sforza family and now houses several museums. Inside, visitors can see an array of Renaissance-era artwork and admire the castle’s inner courtyard. Location: Piazza Castello, Hours: 9am to 5pm Mon-Sun, Entrance fee: €3.

Navigli: This charming Milanese neighborhood is known for its vibrant nightlife and canals. Take a stroll along the canals and enjoy a bite to eat at one of the many restaurants or bars along the way. Location: Naviglio Grande, Hours: All day Mon-Sun, Entrance fee: Free.

Parco Sempione: This large and lively park is perfect for taking a leisurely stroll or biking. Inside, you can find the Torre Branca ferris wheel, the Arco della Pace, and the Civic Aquarium of Milan. Location: Viale Enrico Ibsen, Hours: 6am to 11pm Mon-Sun, Entrance fee: Free.

Quadrilatero della Moda: If you’re a fan of fashion, then this is the place to go. This designer shopping district features boutiques from some of the biggest names in fashion. Location: Via Monte Napoleone & Via della Spiga, Hours: 10am to 8pm Mon-Sat, Entrance fee: Free.

No matter what your interests, Milan is sure to delight. From architectural wonders to sumptuous cuisine, there’s something for everyone. So make sure to make the most of your trip by exploring the city and trying new things. Buon viaggio!

Brig, city in Switzerland, is a true paradise for lovers of nature and history alike. Due to its remarkable climate and landscape, it is one of the most visited cities in the country. Home to stunning opulent alpine villas, pastel-hued houses, and centuries-old churches, Brig is a destination that should not be missed.

Stockalper Castle: Built in 1658, this castle is a symbol of the city's grandeur. amble through the stately halls, where you will come across a wealth of historical artifacts, relics, and paintings. Location: Stockalperstrasse, 3900 Brig, Switzerland. Hours: 9am to 4pm. Admission: 4 CHF. Insider tip: Wander around the castle grounds, where you can marvel at the stunning architecture.

Saint Mary's Church: This 16th-century church is an architectural marvel. Check out the stunning frescoes, which date all the way back to 1467. Location: Oberdorfstrasse, 3900 Brig, Switzerland. Hours: 8am to 8pm. Admission: Free. Insider tip: Take the time to appreciate the beauty of the stained glass windows.

The Stockalper Palace: Built in the 17th century, this Baroque palace was once the home of the illustrious Stockalper family. Admire the majestic architecture and go on a quest for treasure at the majestic 'Treasure Tower'. Location: Stockalperstrasse, 3900 Brig, Switzerland. Hours: 9.30am to 4pm. Admission: 10 CHF. Insider tip: Don't miss out on the spectacular view of the valley from the palace cloisters.

The Simplon Pass: This mountain pass is one of the most famous routes in Switzerland. Take a ride on the Simplon Orient Express panoramic train and admire the picturesque views of the surrounding mountains. Location: 3907 Brig-Simplon, Switzerland. Hours: 8am to 8pm. Admission: 8 CHF. Insider tip: Make sure you take plenty of photos of the breathtaking scenery.

The Egginergarten: This traditional cheese shop is the perfect place to pick up locally-made delicacies. Taste the famous local cheeses like Vacherin and discover the wide range of other homemade products. Location: Bahnhofstrasse, 3900 Brig, Switzerland. Hours: 9am to 6pm. Admission: Free. Insider Tip: Try the ‘Egginergarten’ special, a delicious plate of local cheeses.

Museo della Valle Brigasca: If you wish to learn more about the history and culture of the Brigasca Valley, this museum is a must-visit. Location: Avenue du Simplon, 3900 Brig, Switzerland. Hours: 10am to 4pm. Admission: 5 CHF. Insider tip: Make sure that you visit the second floor, which is dedicated to the history of local mining.

Café Batte: Cap off your visit to Brig with a delicious meal at Café Batte. Enjoy classic Swiss dishes, such as fondue and raclette, accompanied by a glass of local wine. Location: Stadtplatz, 3900 Brig, Switzerland. Hours: 9am to 9pm. Admission: Free. Insider tip: Make sure to try the 'Batte' platter, which is a selection of local specialties.

Exploring Brig is a truly unique experience, and with all these places to visit, you won’t be short of things to do. Whether it’s admiring the grand architecture, going on a cheese tasting adventure, or simply enjoying a delicious meal, your trip to Brig will be an unforgettable one.
